caption: Came here for the first time on Saturday and sat upstairs, I liked it so much we came back on Sunday. We sat waiting for a while for our server and when she finally came we were greeted with frustration. brushed it off and ordered some mimosas.mimosas were brought as the server told us she usually pours the drinks but she’s too busy right now. When gratuity is included you can forget about service most the time. After being rushed and flustered you would think that she could at least take the time to make us feel welcomed. Anyways, There was a bug in our orange juice and when we brought it to the servers attention instead of taking a look for herself she reacts like we’re crazy and proceeds to tell us how she’s sure it’s not a bug. We were disgusted at this point because we did have a sip of our drinks. The server told us don’t worry she will take the orange juice off and expected us to pay for the champagne. With her attitude, service and the bug in our drink we were no longer interested in dining. All after making reservations 6 hours prior and holding off on eating or going somewhere else so that we can come to Brooklyn. We rationally expressed that we will not be finessed into paying for the champagne that we didn’t get to drink. Stuff happens, we get it. We explained that it was not her fault and we are not upset with her and she proceeded about everything the wrong way. Instead of hearing us out she tried getting herself out of the situation by calling us aggressive. no one was aggressive, we were simply expressing our concerns and she constantly cut us off by telling us she will take the orange juice trying to force us into paying and shutting up. If it was anywhere else we wouldn’t even have to be defending ourself.
Bottle girls have class!

I have been here a million times!!! This is my favorite place! Has a modern/urban vibe  inside. They play music like a club (dj booth) upstairs and downstairs, with amazing food. I have NEVER had a dish I haven't liked. I great place to socialize with amazing staff.

Most Unprofessional Restaurant in The District of Columbia 2021 Award goes to Brooklyn on U.  Let’s boycott this place and watch them close down like the other places on U st.  Our server refused to give us separate checks although we all are adults and would prefer to pay for the items we ordered instead of giving drunk people a massive check to sort out. First and last time here. Honestly I will never be returning to this location. This place is a disaster. Save yourself some headache and just walk down to The Smith on U st.  I’m all down for supporting black owned businesses but this place will never ever get a dollar from me again. I hope none of my northwest Washington, DC neighbors visit this place.

the vibes were definitely dope, only issue was that we had a waitress that could've been miss professional with her service and I'll leave it there.  You don't walk off while you're party is talking to you, especially when you're recieving the gratuity. Please remember that gratuity isn't a law. You could've gotten $5 instead of the $100 she recieved. people like to pay for experiences,  not rude employees.

Nope. They need to update their hours. If the place shuts down prior to 2:30am as indicated on your side and Google, be a responsible business owner and update as such.  Aside from that, their security/bouncer is rude. Waiter came around once.  Won’t be back. Realize that you are not the only place that serve a brunch in DC.
Simply the best- love the staff, drinks and food! The Woodfire oven is an amazing touch as well. Brunch is a must once all this covid stuff relaxes.
Good energy, great music , delicious food !
Dope spot for brunch. Nice chill vibes, great food and service!
Dope Food Dope Vibes....

My son took me to Brunch today.. The food was amazing and the mimosa was good.  They were making a Hennessy Slushy which tasted GREAT!  Son is going back next week with friends to watch Football.  They do have an upstairs and outside tables.  So lots of run!

If I could give a zero I would. Me and my boyfriend made a reservation for four people and waited an hour all while watching other people that seemed to have a connect with the host and hostess be seated ahead of us. Horrible customer service!

If I can give them no stars I would. I made a reservation for 5pm and was told to arrive 15 mins early. I complied and when I got there, they weren’t ready to sit us. Furthermore, they were trying to get us a table but, ended up giving to someone else and saying we had to wait 20 minutes on top of the 20 minutes we already had waited there.
Very small space. Security and management are unprofessional and I did not have a desirable experience here, as a black woman.
It's a decent size establishment. The music was good. Drinks were pricey. I like the concept but I haven't really gone there on a busy night to experience it all.
First time here & won't be my last. Food was delish & the atmosphere was live

I normally don’t write reviews but my experience was disturbing. I  would have loved to give 5 stars, the food was good, drinks were good. But the manager lacks customer service skills. I ordered a 2nd drink and before I could even taste it, a guest at the table knocked it over. The server brought me another one right away but charged me for the spilled drink. When I asked the server about the charge he sent the manager to the table. The manager said the server didn’t knock it over so I had to pay for it. The manager sent for the bouncer, who was confused,  because we weren’t loud or argumentative. I guess money must be tight when a business go to that extreme for drink. I was very disappointed especially since this was my first visit and probably my last.
Very chill lay back atmosphere

We popped up post brunch for a drink/chill hangout before more bars open (2pm on a Sunday). Service was good but bartenders were doing double duty with the brunch tables  around us upstairs. Thus service took a minute, although they were very attentive when we got our slotted time.... Overall: Drinks were solid, Decore was Std. (i.e upscale dive bar),  Food... looked decent but didnt try... P.S bathrooms were clean #blackToilets... overall 4 starts will need to go back update after getting a good feel of all they have to offer....
Friday's are great
The coffee is 6.00.  Was confused

Horrible horrible customer experience and service. I saw an ad for a FREE FOOD event on eventbrite at this venue so i thought to check this place out. Worse decision ever all the staff plus manager act as if the never say this add before even though their name is attached and tried to blame it on the promoter. This is what they did to gain a crowd at this place. I explain to the manger and the host and showed both the rsvp ticket I purchased it, the host acknowledged it but the manager said she never seen the ticket yet other people were there on behalf of the ad. The owner treated to call the police I felt very offended  and did not deserve to be treated with such disrespect. The owner was extremely aggressive,  rude and nonchalant folks do not go to this place there are better places in dc with better service. The food was not even worth the price advertised I’m so disappointed the owner couldn’t offer me anything corn atleast coming out to their organization they do care about the customers only the money. I will never return.

Great atmosphere on a Saturday night.  Enjoyed the food and music.  Watched the fight and game at the same time.  Cool crowd.  Lost a star when service dropped off as they got busy and was automatically charged 18% gratuity with only 3 guests when $120 was for bottles of wine. We should have been told NOT surprised.  So be warned.
I had a great time here. Music was poppin an the vibe was right.

Urban feel mixed with sleek a design. A mature young crowd that can mix the older crowd... A nice blend... Bartenders need too engage the customers more though... Customer service is overall better than most spots, I've worked as an bouncer, on the U St corridor...

Horrible! Horrible! The hosted has a nonchalant attitude and server no idea of what to do.  Thirty minutes passed. No water! No order taken!   We proceeded leave was asked "Your Leaving"  the same hostesses we said we are. She said "okay." I've never experienced type service my life. Never return.
Good time
Nice place will go AGAIN!!!
Great atmosphere, food , and Drinks!!! Great lounge right next to the subway station for transportation as well!!
Good lounge

Great ownership. Lit spot and mature clean crowd. I can have fun and sip without worrying too much about the crowd getting rowdy.  It's fun on the weekends but if you want a dope date night, mid week, that few people know about stop through.  Don't go with just a few bucks but it's worth it for sure.
Great service...the fastest I've recieved my food order in forever!! The DJs were dope also!!
Cool, New York-inspired club.
I did not appreciate that they add the tip on my bill.
Nice place, great music!

Friday night's at Brooklyn on U are a delightful throwback to a chill house party with your favorite jams from back in the day. People laughing, dancing and mingling over happy hour specials that include $5 glasses (or $25 pitchers) of margarita and sangria and select wines. Food options include buffalo or old bay wings - fried to the perfect crisp, brick oven pizza, meatballs, fries and arancini. All that and a DJ spinning hits from the 3 decades?? It's a win for me!!!
My new brunch place 💛

Horrible service. Food is not good for the price they are charging. Food came out cold . After we paid our bill, we wanted to enjoy our bottomless mimosa and the hostess made us get up and sit at the bar  which was unacceptable. She claimed they were a group people that have made reservation so therefore we had to get up.  The only thing that was ok was the DJ playing good music. Don’t waste your money if you are looking for good food and service.
Desserts, service, vibe all good!!

This restaurant has absolutely spoiled my husband 30 surprise birthday dinner. I made reservations for 15ppl, 3 of them traveled from NYC and when I arrived to the restaurant at 9p on Wednesday july17 they were CLOSED. I’ve had this  reservation booked since June 1. I called several received no answer and and I’ve also left several voice message and no one returned my call! I had to at the last minute rearrange his entire dinner party with then telling him that I was surprising him with the ppl that were coming.... this was very horrible and unprofessional and I will never ever reserve with this place and I will also be sure to pass the word along for others to not waste their time.
Don't waste your time way too pricey bartenders are horrible service is terrible area so badd not worth the trip again
Awesomeness on U street!!! I will definitely be back....I had a Blast⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Alex was GREAT! She was the only one who made us feel like humans(group of 4), besides her we were treated horribly. We were forced to put our cards on file and didnt get our cards back for ATLEAST 10 minutes! They ran out of certain foods, the food was tasteless, I was given a glass with lipgloss on it. Then the icing on the cake was they brought my friend's change back in ALL NICKELS AND DIMES!
Great food, chic environment wonderful music  & nice location!
The pizza is FANTASTIC.

I came here Mother's Day after a horribly rude experience at Marvin's. The bartender AND the barback were very friendly and had no problem talking to me. And I had the best French 76 there too. Will definitely be back. Thanks
It can get better
Automatic gratuity? Offensive

This place is nice but as far as working here they will hire and not pay you for weeks and discredit your work ethic. Worked there and never was paid. Other employees also said they waited weeks to be paid. It’s against the law to use someone for work and not compensate even if they are no longer there for training or work. NIce place to eat, but work wise the manager Kitty will not be direct and will not pay you for your time regardless if she sees you fit or not for the job.  Update 6/1/2019 the owner contacted me and resolved the issue they had no idea what happened and paid for my time there. The restaurant is a good restaurant, I enjoyed everything about it and the staff was nice and helpful BUT Kitty one of the managers needs to either switch locations or step down. She is not a nice person and did not contact me or tried to pay me for my time.
Nice clean place enjoyed myself

I stumbled upon Brooklyn on U and am so lucky I did! I am still salivating over the customized salmon dish the chef made for me two nights ago and I have been gushing about this place to everyone I talk to. This restaurant was amazing at handling my multiple food allergies. The staff is very well trained and is happy to cater to any dietary restrictions. The food and drink menus have something for everyone and the prices are standard for what one can expect in downtown DC.  I can't thank Marla and Franco enough for providing me with an unparalleled dining experience in DC. I will be back soon!
I’m in here RIGHT NOW SOBER MIND........Absolutely freaking amazing! From the front desk to the service to the music and food I was blown away!!!!!!!!

Loved my experience. Great drinks although it took a while for the drinks to come out. Good music vibes!! The food waa good  had the BK frito misto (calamari). Great chilled placed. Really loved the vibe!

Brooklyn is an amazing bar/ lounge on U street. I got to go with a group of my girlfriends and Rose the waitress was the best it was loud in there and some drunk person spilled our drinks and Rose came over had it cleaned up and us drinking again. If you go there ask for her she’s the best she made our whole night.

What a cute spot!  The service was terrible but the manager was very apologetic and explained that it was an off night.  I'll give it another chance especially because the drinks were really good and the food was very tasty.  The DJ also kept the place live all night.
Came for a birthday party happy hour a few weeks ago.  Here today with my girls for Sunday Brunch.  Great all around experience both times!  From the drinks to the food.  I will be regular.
Great place to enjoy ur self

BROOKLYN ON U STREET!!! Where do I even begin?! The energy and vibe of this place is so damn beautiful! The owner is wonderful and charismatic. The people that work here provide impeccable service! The Dj named Cheick knows just the right music to play at the right time! From hip hop, r&b, to electric or salsa.. His taste in music is everything. Brooklyn on U street is now my go to place every weekend!!!! Just what Washington, D.C. needed!! Yayyyyyyyy 🙌🏽😍

My boyfriend and I, went there on a Friday night. I must say the atmosphere, ambiance, food and service was great. Our waitress Rose was very friendly and welcoming. Also, very knowleadgeable about the menu. She had great suggestions for us, the food and drinks exceeded our expectation. It's definitely a win in our books.
Good service downstairs.  Very confusing service to get to the next room upstairs
Brooklyn on U is an amazing spot!!!  Good food n sips!
Gets nice around 10 PM.  Nice scene and DJ is pretty good.
Great food and vibes ! Rose was our server and she was friendly and gave great service and food/drink recommendations ! I will be going again.

The brunch was terrible. They brought out nasty food which ran out because everyone there was waiting hours to eat. People and even myself had paid a decent amount for unlimited brunch that was very limited. I couldn't made eggs and bacon at home myself. I WOULD NOT SUGGEST GOING HERE.
Such a fun vibe ! Great food, drinks and music :) Will definitely be back anytime I am in DC

I love this place! I'm from the DC area and although there are many dinning and lounge options, many lack elegance and comfort with great music! During the week, Brooklyn is a great place to grab a delicious pizza and cocktail provding cool music vibes in the background. One time I went there on a Saturday night and it had a real nice diverse crowd. I think I found my neighborhood spot for all occasions! Thanks!

My experience at Brooklyn on U has been nothing short of amazing the two times I have gone. First off, the atmosphere is awesome. The place is beautifully decorated with a chic yet simplistic style. The music isn't too loud or too low and the songs were on point, an eclectic mix. Second, the drinks are bomb. All the specialty cocktails I tried were nicely blended and ornately garnished, a perfect paring for the food. We tried the Tuna Poke, Arugula Salad, and the Salmon entree. All of these dishes were exceptional. The tuna was delicious, not the least bit "fishy" tasting. The arugula salad was dressed well, and the salmon had spectacular flavor. My friend also tried the Burrata, which I had a bite of. The mozzarella was super creamy, I was definitely impressed. On my second visit, my friends and I bought a table for a birthday celebration. We had a phenomenal  time! The music was fun, a nice mix of today's hits and the classics. The bottle service was on point, our cocktail waitress poured our drinks for us and everything. Ultimately, my experiences at Brooklyn on U have been really great, I will definitely be coming back!

I agree with all of these reviews! Great food, great ambiance, but, in addition to the upscale vibes, Brooklyn on U provides top notch service! Personally, the level of customer service blew me away. I felt extremely welcome from the moment I walked in the door, everyone that works there greeted me like I was the local neighborhood regular.  From the man/woman that check's your ID, to the bartender, to the bouncer, to the coat check personnel! To me, more than anything, this is what sets an establishment a part from the rest. I look forward to visiting again.
Great time and the drinks are fabulous

Brooklyn is such a VIBE. I love everything about it from the food to the drinks to their lounge area and more. I’ve been there a couple of times already and each time I went, I’ve had nothing but a pleasant experience. The staff is super nice and attentive and they provide exceptional service. I also love how they have the restaurant on the first floor and the lounge on the second floor, especially on the weekends. You have the option of grabbing dinner and then heading up to the lounge right after for some fun. It’s definitely not your typical U St spot. It’s very classy and sophisticated but with a twist of fun and good times. Brooklyn is definitely in my top 5 spots in DC and I can’t wait to go back!

So I went to the Grand Opening of Brooklyn on U street & went another time a week after. I must say, I really loved the atmosphere of this place! Both levels give you the best of both worlds: a New York Brooklyn vibe with the perfect touch of DC’s U street! I like how they didn’t overdue the different features they had on each level. It’s the perfect mix of a Restaurant, Lounge & Sportsbar! Definitely check it out!
Love, love, love everything about this place! Very friendly staff, cool vibes and delicious food!

Best restaurant lounge in U street!!!....Excellent food. Atmosphere. Music and Fun. I Had dinner couple times here with my girls. Menu is perfect, something for everyone. Service was awesome, from walking in the door and being greeted by employee, food was serve hot, excellent taste, presentation and quality! Will definitely come back, highly recommended!

Brooklyn is a very unique place on U street. The food is amazing, especially the Salmon and the specialty cocktails are very tasty. The service is super attentive and nice. Brooklyn also has a lounge upstairs where they offer bottle service on the weekends, a dj that plays a mix of different music and a diverse and classy crowd. Overall you’ll have a great experience at Brooklyn whether you’re dining in the restaurant or turning up in the lounge.
BROOKLYN Restaurant  & Lounge has definitely revitalized, the U Street corridor.  Such class... The ambiance & food, should definitely be an experience everyone should partake.

When I heard the story of how Brooklyn came about I just knew it was gonna be something special. When you walk in restaurant it speaks elegance. The scented candles and great looking people greeting you very welcoming.  The lit flower decor in the front is  very charming . The menu selection is pretty solid and the food was great. Now dont be fooled Brooklyn does gets lit!!  The lounge was awesome and music on point !! Through my whole experience there I felt they did a great job.  I will definitely be a regular!!
If you haven’t been yet it’s a U street must!
Brooklyn is the new “It” spot in DC. Great customer service, great staff, and great atmosphere! Definitely a must see spot. Changing the game on U street.
Great place to have a great time, along with fantastic music and food selection

Brooklyn is the best thing to happen to DC! It's located in the cool and historic U St. area alongside many other historic venues. It's a cross between modern "cool and hip" and luxury. This place is nice for pretty much any occasion. Whether you are celebrating something, on a date, or just out for a quick drink with friends - this is the place to go! I have so many great things to say about this place, I don't even know where to start.  For starters, the service here is great! The minute you walk in, you are taken care of with smiling faces. The team is also very knowledgeable about not only food but night life as well. Making everyone's experience enjoyable from start to finish.  The downstairs area is a bar and restaurant, and the upstairs area is a lounge with plush velvet seats. It's a one stop shop and you never have to leave. After you eat, you can have a drink at the bar, or go upstairs and party all night long with a popping DJ! The ambiance is super cool with a lot of different photo ops. There are are neon lights with cool sayings like, "it was all a dream," "brooklyn," etc. The grass walls and brick walls also add a great touch. They have live DJs weekly too. The cocktails are very cool (instagram worthy with edible garnishes) and have just the right amount of alcohol in them. *Meet me at Cardoza is my favorite.*  Lastly, the food definitely has bragging rights. I hate pesto, but the pesto pizza here is to die for! The pesto sauce is house made, so it has a very fresh and flavorful taste. I also really enjoyed the salmon. IT IS COOKED TO PERFECTION.  The service, vibe, and food here are perfectly balanced. If you're in the area, you have to try this place!

Shady tactics. Left the bar after ordering just one beer and forgot to close out my tab. Bartender proceeded to add a 121 dollar tip to my bill! Very shady and unprofessional. Will never attend an event there again!

Well me and two friends just left and we all had mixed reviews of this place. While it is a beautiful restaurant and the service was good, paying $12.00 for a vodka Sprite was a little much.  The speciality cocktails, $14.00 were very tasty and I would have to say worth the price. It might do them well to have a happy hour with hh prices.The music was so loud, me and my guests had to fight to hear each other between the loud music and 6 women screaming to talk over the music.  The problem came with the food. We ordered the mac and cheese with bacon and jalapeno and we all thought it fell flat in the taste category.  From then on we ordered the sausage pizza and once again, we all felt it missed the mark. It was luke warm and not very flavorful. I was in the mood to try the prosciutto and arugula pizza. Wow, once again we were all in agreement that this was one of the worse pizza we had ever had. We recalled Jumbo Slice from down the street as a worthy comparison. The pizza was half prosciutto and cheese and the other side was arugula and cheese. Not so much prosciutto but lots of cheese. Most of the arugula was cooked into the cheese offering no real taste of the arugula. It was also very greasy and  bland (but garlicky). I would recommend the owners take a short  walk up the street to Paola to see how real pizzas are made. We will go back to try other offerings but this was not a good start.

Really great service from the moment you walk in the door. The ambiance was trendy, with a live DJ and fresh flowers adorning brick walls and wooden tables. The mac and cheese may be the best I've had in the city in years. Each of our seven entrees were tasty with standard portion sizes - we really liked that the salmon came with lentils. Our drinks were presented with floral garnishes or fresh cucumbers. Each had really robust flavor, so we probably drank more than intended, because every new drink brought to the table gave someone else cocktail envy. The prices were very reasonable. I would definitely return and recommend.

Just visited last weekend and can’t wait come again! The location is super central (right next to metro), the venue is modern and inviting. I visited the “night club“ (the music was AWESOME) but I can’t wait to go during the day and try out the food. Great spot in DC and worth a visit!
My lady and I had a wonderful experience visiting this lounge and I would definitely return to this business in the near future.

Brooklyn is the new ELEGANCE of U Street!!! From the atmosphere, to the décor, friendly staff, to the well dressed hostess when you enter the establishment. They didn't miss one detail on how to make their guest feel welcome. The food is GREAT! And a music is AMAZING! There's something for everyone at Brooklyn. The new hot spot in DC! Go Meet Her!
Love this new restaurant! The space is beautiful and everyone is very welcoming.
Staff was friendly, atmosphere was tremendous. Cant wait to go back!

Brooklyn has a very warm, diversed, and appealing atmosphere for both family and friends gatherings.  It's designed for the younger and older adult population.  The food is excellent!  The staff are friendly and professional, and the music is great!  A taste of New York in upper Washington DC.  Love it!!

Went there for the grand opening. Music, food, people and the vibe was just AMAZING!  We loved the venue, it is by far the nicest spot on U-Street! Even though it was crowded that night, it didnt feel uncomfortably packed, due to it's two levels. Definitely new go to spot!
Brooklyn was such a good time and good vibes ! The setting is nice and so are the owners/bartenders. Can’t wait to go back on my night out to dc.
Great place to relax and have a great glass of wine. Love the look I will be back soon
Already the best spot in DC !!!!
Great spot! The bartenders were really friendly and quick despite being mobbed. Had good music going on both floors. Easy to find as it's right across from Ben's Chili Bowl.
Awesome spot with great music! Easily accessible via metro and it's right across from Ben's Chili Bowl if you want a late night snack after a night of dancing!
Great staff, all very welcoming. Music on point. Great vibes, great spot! Will definitely be a regular!
Love this spot the owners are super nice and the atmosphere is lively. My new go to place in the city!

Brooklyn is very inviting! The staff, decor, and diverse atmosphere will definitely make anyone a return customer. Great concept of eating great food and ending your evening up stairs in their lounge area where you can dance, order bottle service or just enjoy the one of their specialty cocktails!
Very inviting atmosphere. Great staff. I recommend Brooklyn for a nice chill spot. It's a must to experience!
